title: Definitions
context: [Part VI.] pregnant offenders; restraints [ยง353-121] Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Labor&rdquo; means the period of time before a birth during which contractions are of sufficient frequency, intensity, and duration to bring about effacement and progressive dilation of the cervix. &ldquo;Postpartum recovery&rdquo; means: (1) The entire period a female is in a hospital, birthing center, or clinic after giving birth; and (2) An additional time period, if any, a treating physician determines is necessary for healing after the female leaves the hospital, birthing center, or clinic. &ldquo;Restraints&rdquo; means anything used to control the movement of a person&rsquo;s body or limbs and includes: (1) Physical restraint; or (2) A mechanical device, including metal handcuffs, plastic ties, ankle restraints, leather cuffs, other hospital-type restraints, tasers, or batons. &ldquo;Transport&rdquo; means the conveyance, by any means, of a committed person from the correctional facility to another location, including travel to and from a transport vehicle. [L 2011, c 174, pt of ยง1]
